intro: Rhododendron fulvastrum subsp. mesopolium, commonly known as the Himalayan rhododendron, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, preferring cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while the flowers range in color from white to pink. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitats.
